column4: Could someone assist me with getting my latop's ATI graphics card running right?  I can get into xwindows fine, but the redraw is really, really slow
its an ATI Mobility X200
I have tried reinstalling fglrx, but it doesn't work
do you have Option "NoAccel" "true" in your xorg.conf file?
no, but I do have composite set to disabled, as on the forums people said that could be an option
problem, not option
It was working fine under Dapper, but got messed up when I dist-upgraded to Edgy
I also have composite disabled and for 2D my card works pretty fast. I know it works slow in my case if I disable acceleration... but in your case the problem seems to be another issue
edgy messed a lot of things... fonts in gnome, xservers, etc. :(
Yeah, and I've been pouring over the forums for days trying to get it working.
is there an "easy" way to get back to dapper?
I don't know probably not easier as reinstalling from scratch everything and install your backup (if any)
but probably your problem has a solution.
Possible.  I'm not looking forward to fighting with my wi-fi again.  That was a simular nightmare
well I am really dissapointed with that edgy release, I expected more from ubuntu, really. Just a small rant :)
heh, yeah.  I remember my other attempts at Debian all getting messed up when updating.
Is there a way to purge all the ATI stuff from the system, go back to VESA, and try installing an older driver?
well now that xorg is modularized it should be easy, I mean just uninstall all packages with dpkg -l | grep ati, but this can be dangerous too
right, but if the worst that happens is I reinstall dapper again, then its no big loss and a learning experience
if you have your /home or your important files in another partition it should not be any problem too. OTOH in my case the fglrx drivers from ati were also crap and freezed my machine
is there another driver I should try?  (Backups are easy, I have a 1.27TB server for that)
I've never tried with anything different than ati or fglrx on this machine... so I am not really sure. you could try vesa
well, I think al I have tried is the one I downloaded from ATI.  Is there a second one?
well, let me try the free ati ones
